events.name: René Brandel
events.bio:
Ex-AWS - inventor of Amazon Kiro. CEO - CASCO. Hacked his YC batch’s MCP server to show vulnerabilities. Super excited to speak at DevSecCon 2025 on behalf of Casco (YC X25)! The theme for this year is "Securing the Shift to AI Native" and my talk will share the story on how we hacked our YC batchmates' AI agents. 

Watch his AI Engineers talk:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kv-QAuKWllQ

events.name: Jessica Smith
events.bio:
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/jessicasmith-jd/

GUEST BACKGROUND:
- Member of Kirton McConkie's International section, IP litigation and AI advisory
- JD from BYU J. Reuben Clark Law School (2022), BA in Ancient Near Eastern Studies—Biblical Hebrew
- Bar admissions: District of Columbia (2022) and Utah (2024)
- Strong cybersecurity background: "Best in Injects, Collaboration, and Service Uptime" at International Collegiate Cyber Defense Invitational (2018)
- Academic excellence: Top score in IP Litigation, first place in 2L/3L Negotiation Competition

KIRTON MCCONKIE OVERVIEW:
- Utah's premier multi-service law firm with 200+ attorneys across 5 offices
- One of the largest IP practices in the Intermountain West
- AV Preeminent Rated IP firm, repeatedly recognized as top patent firm
- Global reach: attorneys serve clients in 150+ countries

AI & LEGAL TECHNOLOGY EXPERTISE:
- AI implementation advisory and compliance frameworks
- Converts complex legal requirements into actionable business processes
- Drafts plain-English AI policies and contracts
- IP protection for AI innovations, patent prosecution experience
- International AI regulatory compliance (EU AI Act, US regulations)

ACADEMIC CONTRIBUTIONS:
- Published "Let Me Get My Human for That: The Struggles of a Broken Patent System for AI Inventors"
- Analyzes AI inventorship in patent law across multiple jurisdictions
- Proposes practical solutions including "work made for hire" concepts for AI
- Addresses international harmonization needs for AI patent law

POTENTIAL INTERVIEW TOPICS:
1. The AI Inventor Dilemma - who owns AI-generated innovations
2. From Code to Compliance - translating AI regulations into business practice
3. Global AI Governance - navigating international regulatory frameworks
4. AI Risk Management for Legal Teams - developing comprehensive governance
5. Plain English AI Policies - making complex AI law accessible
6. Women in Legal Tech - unique path from cybersecurity to AI law

References:

events.name: Elizabeth Leone
events.bio:
GUEST BACKGROUND:
- Developer Advocate at AWS specializing in AI/ML and Data Analytics
- Based in Chile, serves English and Spanish-speaking developer communities worldwide
- Bridge between complex technical concepts and accessible developer education
- Deep expertise in Amazon Bedrock, generative AI, multi-modal content processing, and vector databases
- Active participation in AWS Community Days across Latin America

AWS STRANDS AGENTS EXPERTISE:
- Foremost expert on AWS Strands Agents (open-source SDK for building AI agents with minimal code)
- Created comprehensive tutorial series on multi-modal content processing (images, documents, videos)
- Developed custom video_reader tool for advanced video processing needs
- Demonstrated FAISS integration for local development and Amazon S3 Vectors for enterprise scale
- Created AWS CDK patterns for deploying Strands Agents as Lambda functions

KEY ACHIEVEMENTS & PROJECTS:
- Multi-Modal AI Agents: capable of extracting data from PDFs, analyzing images, understanding video sequences
- WhatsApp Travel Agent: RAG-powered customer service with PostgreSQL integration
- Serverless Multi-Modal Search Engine: Amazon Titan Embeddings + Amazon Bedrock + LangChain
- AWS News Blog regular contributor and multi-part tutorial series author
- Professional workshop: "Building a RAG System for Video Search and Analysis" at API World 2025

EDUCATIONAL PHILOSOPHY:
- Progressive complexity approach: fundamentals to sophisticated concepts
- Hands-on learning with complete, runnable code examples
- Focus on real-world business challenges vs academic exercises
- Making complex AI technologies approachable for all skill levels
- Democratizing AI knowledge across diverse global communities

TECHNICAL FOCUS AREAS:
- Multi-Agent Architectures with advanced coordination systems
- Multi-Modal Processing: unified AI systems handling text, images, video, audio
- Serverless AI Deployment: cost-effective, scalable deployment patterns
- Vector Database Integration: large-scale vector data management in production

POTENTIAL INTERVIEW TOPICS:
1. Evolution of AI Agent Development - how Strands Agents changes the landscape
2. Multi-Modal AI Future - challenges and opportunities in diverse content processing
3. Democratizing AI - making advanced AI accessible to mainstream developers
4. Cross-Cultural Tech Education - building inclusive international communities
5. Enterprise AI Adoption - practical challenges moving from experimental to production
6. Next-Generation AI Frameworks - where agent development is heading

events.name: Oli Dinov
events.bio:
Organizer of "AI By the Bay 2025" conference

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/anastasia-khomyakova-538952271/

Oli Dinov is focused on reliable AI engineering. This includes using typed languages such as Rust rather than Python, and other practices designed to make AI-engineering safe.

Oli Dinov has actively participated in and led public discussions on reliable AI engineering, particularly through her role with the AI By The Bay conference, which she founded to spotlight enterprise-scale, dependable AI systems. She regularly engages the engineering community on topics like data infrastructure for AI, distributed system challenges, and techniques for building maintainable, trustworthy AI solutions. In talks and organizational posts, Oli emphasizes that the current era is one of AI-native programming where reliability, data engineering, and scalable distributed systems are essential for trustworthy AI in production use.​​

At recent events and in podcasts, Oli and her conference addressed critical challenges such as:
Ensuring "safety in foundational models," with a focus on trustworthy deployment and quality in real-world AI engineering.​
The need for specialized infrastructure (hardware and software) to support high-throughput, always-on AI data pipelines.​​
Holistic thinking about software engineering for AI, supporting the move toward always-on "co-pilot" environments where AI reliability is foundational.​​

Oli's LinkedIn presence further highlights her dedication to creating empowered, innovative teams working on reliable enterprise AI. She also advocates for context-driven approaches to AI system design, with an emphasis on data pipelines, model safety, and continuous integration of new reliability standards for AI in production environments.​

events.name: Linda Haviv
events.bio:
Linda Haviv - AWS Developer Advocate

Research Information

Current Organization: AWS (Amazon Web Services)
Title/Position: Developer Advocate
Department: Works with engineering, product, and education teams focused on developer experience and enablement; collaborates closely with AWS service teams

AI-Related Expertise

Generative AI and AI-first engineering
Practical applications of AI technologies
Developer experience optimization for AI services
AI-powered tool development (including AI-powered CLI applications using Retrieval-Augmented Generation)

Specialization Areas

Developer enablement for generative AI
Translating technical AI innovation into real-world applications
Building technical content and educational programs for AI services adoption
Cloud technologies and infrastructure

Background

Linda Haviv transitioned into tech from media production through a coding bootcamp and has progressed through roles as Software Developer, Infrastructure Engineer, and Site Reliability Engineer before her current Developer Advocate position at AWS. She describes herself as a "professional student" with a focus on continuous learning in emerging cloud and AI technologies.

Professional Profiles

LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/lindahaviv
Speaker Bio (WIN Summit): https://www.winsummit.com/speaker-bios

Source Citations:

[1] https://dev.to/tech-careers/9-linda-haviv-bootcamp-to-cloud
[3] https://www.winsummit.com/speaker-bios
[5] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V-3a2ZG_KMo
